intro: Stenocarpus latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf hakea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive, urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are broad and leathery, often with a waxy coating, and its flowers are usually pink or red, appearing in summer. Stenocarpus latifolius is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas.
